info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 4 at 10:44AM CDT until June 7 at 12:36AM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas...
Cottonwood River near Plymouth affecting Lyon and Chase Counties.
Neosho River near Erie affecting Neosho County.
Neosho River near Chanute affecting Neosho and Allen Counties.
Neosho River at Iola affecting Allen County.
Neosho River near Parsons affecting Neosho and Labette Counties.
Neosho River at Oswego affecting Labette and Cherokee Counties.
Cottonwood River at Cottonwood Falls affecting Chase County.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kansas...
Cottonwood River near Florence affecting Marion County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Cottonwood River at Cottonwood Falls.
* WHEN...Until early Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, In Strong City flood waters cover Highway 177 in and around 2nd Street where this section of town sits lower in elevation. Expect Highway 177 to be closed from Cottonwood Falls to Strong City.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:55 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 1045 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING
